hotel_description: Our hotel began its journey in 2019 and has since become one of the most respected and trusted hotels in Uzbekistan. With a focus on comfort, service, and convenience, we offer everything needed for a pleasant stay — from easy access to city landmarks to modern facilities and welcoming staff. Whether you're here for business or leisure, our goal is to make your experience smooth, relaxing, and memorable.
hotel_intro: A perfect blend of comfort and elegance, our hotel offers thoughtfully designed spaces and warm hospitality to make every stay unforgettable.
fast_internet_desc: Our hotel provides one of the fastest Wi-fi
swimming_pool_desc: Relax by our crystal-clear swimming pool.
parking_desc: Space for your car at the hotel.
pool_clean_water: Clean, well-maintained water with regular upkeep
pool_equipped: Includes swimming accessories for guest use
gym_equipment: Equipped with the latest cardio and strength machines
restaurant_meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner available daily
restaurant_atmosphere: Cozy atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating
parking_free: Free on-site parking for all guests
sauna_description: Traditional dry heat sauna for deep relaxation
review_vladimir: Very neat hotel, polite and friendly staff, cozy rooms, delicious buffet-style breakfasts. Convenient location. Nearby there is a clinic, a pharmacy, and within a short walk Giotto, Gavkhar, and Vanil — dining spots. You can quickly reach any part of the city.
review_1: Visited Khorezm in January, it was very cold outside (-10°C), but it was warm and cozy inside the hotel. The pool was operational. The breakfast was excellent — great variety! Good staff. Rooms were very clean.
review_2: Good hotel, friendly staff, good service. Great location, close to the airport, beautiful interior. Overall, I liked it. I recommend it for your stay.
facade_makeover_title: HOTEL UZBEKISTAN’s facade gets a stunning makeover!
facade_makeover_desc: HOTEL UZBEKISTAN unveiled its fully renovated facade featuring modern design elements combined with traditional Uzbek patterns. The refreshed look creates a welcoming and contemporary atmosphere for all guests.
shahrukhan_visit_title: Famous singer Shahrukhan visits HOTEL UZBEKISTAN!
shahrukhan_visit_desc: HOTEL UZBEKISTAN had the honor of hosting renowned singer Shahrukhan. The celebrity enjoyed the hotel’s luxurious amenities and praised its exceptional hospitality. Guests were thrilled to catch a glimpse of their favorite star during their stay.
yulduz_visit_title: Famous singer Yulduz Usmanova visits HOTEL UZBEKISTAN!
yulduz_visit_desc: HOTEL UZBEKISTAN welcomed the famous singer Yulduz Usmanova. She was pleased with the hotel’s hospitality, and guests were happy to see the star!
farrukh_visit_title: Famous singer Farrukh Zakirov visits HOTEL UZBEKISTAN!
farrukh_visit_desc: HOTEL UZBEKISTAN gladly hosted renowned singer Farrukh Zakirov. He highly appreciated the hotel’s hospitality and comfort. Guests were delighted to meet the legend!
awaited_comfort_1: The Comfort You’ve Been Waiting For
healthy_lifestyle: Maintain a healthy lifestyle with modern fitness equipment
business_events_description: Spacious, comfortable hall for business meetings and special events (up to 50 people)
cuisine_description: Daily breakfast and dinner buffet with a wide selection
best_prices_desc: Our hotel offers competitive rates to ensure you get the best value for your stay without overpaying.
convenient_booking_desc: Booking a room is simple and fast through our website or by phone, making the process easy for every guest.
best_services_desc: Our team is committed to providing consistent, professional service to make your stay comfortable and worry-free.
airport_transfer_desc: Easy rides from and to the airport.
fayz_visit_title: Renowned Singer Alisher Fayz Visits Uzbekistan Hotel
fayz_visit_text: Famous singer Alisher Fayz recently visited Uzbekistan Hotel, making it a memorable day for our guests and staff.
rahmatullaev_visit_title: Star Visit: Ulug‘bek Rahmatullaev at Uzbekistan Hotel
rahmatullaev_visit_text: Renowned singer Ulug‘bek Rahmatullaev stayed at Uzbekistan Hotel, delighting fans and staff with his presence and charm. His visit added a touch of stardom to our welcoming atmosphere.
form_response_note: Fill the form and we respond within 24 hours
name: Name
q1: How do I make a reservation?
a1: You can book directly on our website or call our reception.
q2: Is there a gym or pool?
a2: Yes, we have both. Access is free for guests.
q3: Is Wi-Fi available in the rooms?
a3: Yes, free high-speed Wi-Fi is available throughout the hotel.
q4: Do the rooms have a minibar or safe?
room_standard_description: A cozy and affordable room with essential amenities.
room_superior_description: More space and comfort with upgraded features.
room_studio_description: An open-plan room with sleeping and living areas combined.
room_lux_description: A premium room with elegant design and high-end amenities.
room_lux_suite_description: A spacious suite with separate living and sleeping areas for a luxurious stay.
about_standard_description_1: The Standard Room has a comfortable double bed, soft lighting, and enough storage space. Our room provides a quiet and clean environment for rest. The room also includes a private bathroom with a shower, a workspace with Wi-Fi, and basic amenities like a mini-fridge and TV for your convenience.
room_size: Average size: 210 sq m / 2260 sq ft
private_terrace: Large private terrace with seating and dining areas, directly accessible from the master bedroom — designed for comfort and outdoor use.
windows: Floor-to-ceiling windows that slide open, offering natural light and a connection to the outside in a high-tech, functional setting.
living_area: Open living and dining area with a modern kitchen and smart features, suitable for both short and extended stays.
bedroom: Comfortable bedroom with terrace access, climate control, and simple tech integrations for an easy, modern experience.
no_dangerous_items: Dangerous goods and items not allowed
illegal_activities_not_allowed: Visitors engaging in illegal or inappropriate activities are not permitted.
about_superior_description: The Superior Room offers enhanced comfort with a spacious layout, a high-quality double bed, and modern design elements. It includes a private bathroom, a work desk with Wi-Fi, a mini-fridge, and a flat-screen TV—perfect for a relaxed and productive stay.
about_studio_description: The Studio Room stands out with various added functionalities. It features a sleeping area, sitting space, and a compact kitchenette in a clean, open layout. Guests can enjoy a private bathroom, Wi-Fi, and a TV, making it ideal for longer stays or added independence.
about_lux_description: The Lux Room provides a refined and spacious environment with elegant furnishings and a premium king-size bed. It includes a large bathroom with upgraded amenities, a minibar, smart TV, and extra space to relax or work in comfort.
about_lux_suite_description: Our most luxurious option, the Lux & Suite Room features a separate bedroom and living area for maximum space and privacy. It offers a premium bathroom, two TVs, a coffee machine, a minibar, and stylish seating and dining areas—ideal for extended stays or special occasions.
staff_service: Our polite and attentive staff are always ready to provide exceptional service, ensuring your stay is as comfortable and pleasant as possible.
bed_info: Two single beds or one double bed, baby cot available on request
marital_status_requirement: Guests are required to present valid documentation confirming their marital status upon check-in.
arda_khiva_slogan: Arda Khiva – Modern Living in Historic Khiva
kalta_minor_slogan: Kalta Minor – The Unfinished Icon of Khiva
khiva_museum_about: The Khiva Museum, established in 1970, is a prominent cultural and educational institution dedicated to preserving and showcasing the rich history and heritage of Khiva and the surrounding region. As a multidisciplinary center, the museum plays a vital role in research, conservation, and public education. It houses an extensive collection of artifacts that represent the artistic, architectural, and everyday life traditions of Khiva’s past. The museum serves not only as a guardian of the city’s cultural legacy but also as a hub for promoting historical awareness and appreciation among locals and visitors alike. Since its foundation, the Khiva Museum has been instrumental in supporting scholarly research and fostering cultural dialogue, solidifying its place as a key institution in Uzbekistan’s preservation of history.
khiva_museum_title: Khiva Museum – A Legacy of History Since 1970
ichan_qala_desc: The walled inner city of Khiva, a UNESCO World Heritage site, featuring well-preserved palaces, mosques, madrasahs, and traditional houses that showcase centuries of Central Asian history.
kalta_minor_desc: An iconic, unfinished turquoise-tiled minaret that stands at the entrance of Ichan Qal'a, famous for its striking colors and architectural uniqueness.
kunya_ark_desc: The old citadel of Khiva that served as the residence of Khivan khans, including defensive structures, a mosque, a harem, and a prison.
tosh_hovli_desc: A 19th-century royal palace known for its exquisite tilework, decorated ceilings, and intricately designed courtyards, illustrating the luxury of Khivan rulers.
juma_mosque_desc: Renowned for its forest of over 200 wooden pillars, some dating back over a thousand years, this mosque is a masterpiece of Islamic architecture and local craftsmanship.
islam_khoja_desc: The tallest minaret in Khiva, offering panoramic views of the city, alongside an adjoining mosque that exemplifies 19th-century Khivan architecture.
muhammad_amin_desc: Once the largest madrasa in Central Asia, this educational complex impresses visitors with its grand façade, spacious courtyard, and historical significance.
pakhlavan_mahmud_desc: A revered mausoleum dedicated to the famous poet and warrior Pakhlavan Makhmud, showcasing beautiful tilework and a peaceful garden.
nurullaboy_desc: A 20th-century royal residence located just outside Ichan Qal'a, built by the Khivan khans to impress Russian envoys. It blends traditional Khivan architecture with European influences and features grand halls, elegant interiors, and a rich royal atmosphere.
weapons_desc: Explore swords, daggers, bows, and chainmail armor used by Khivan warriors, palace guards, and noblemen. These items not only served in defense but also demonstrated craftsmanship and social rank. Many weapons from this period were adorned with silver inlays and inscriptions, making them ceremonial as well as functional.
ceramics_desc: Khivan ceramics are known for their turquoise and cobalt-blue glaze, intricate patterns, and durability. These bowls, plates, and pitchers were commonly used in homes and madrassahs, often featuring floral or geometric designs typical of the Khorezm region’s aesthetic traditions.
textiles_desc: Silk ikat robes (chapan), embroidered headdresses, and handwoven belts were essential in the wardrobe of both everyday citizens and aristocrats. These garments reflected social status, regional identity, and local weaving mastery. Natural dyes and unique color combinations give each piece historical character.
ok_masjid_museum: Museum of the History of German Mennonites in Ok Mosque
melon_festival_title: Melon Festival Concludes in Khiva — Who are the Winners?
melon_festival_description: As part of the event, 60 pavilions from the administrations of Karakalpakstan, regions, and Tashkent, as well as thirteen cities and districts of the Khorezm region, were placed on a 4-hectare square. They showcased fruits and vegetables grown in the regions, handicrafts, and around 125 varieties of melons, including 'Gurvak', 'Kilichboy Beshak', 'Karikiz', 'Tuya Kavun', 'Toyona', 'Ola Zamcha', 'Khorezm Ok Novvot', 'Kuk Gulobi', 'Borikalla'. At the end of the festival, winners and prize holders were announced. The Grand Prix — a Tracker car — was awarded to Yangibazar district of Khorezm region. First place went to Urgench (Onix car), second to Khiva district (Damas car), and third was shared by Urgench district, Khiva city, and Koshkupir district (motorcycles).
arda_khiva_title: Modern Tourism Complex Opened in Khiva
arda_khiva_description: Efforts to unlock the tourism potential of Khorezm region are yielding significant results. Compared to seven or eight years ago, the number of foreign tourists visiting the region has increased 30 times. As a result of transformations in the sector, the region's tourism services exports rose from $7 million in 2017 to $380 million last year. In the past, people only thought of Itchan Kala when it came to tourism in the region. Now, perceptions have changed dramatically. Over 40 tourist routes have been developed, and their total number has reached 100. Now, there is a new unique complex — Arda Khiva. Its opening was a major event during the President’s visit to the region. The complex, located within an ancient settlement, resembles a distinctive city. It harmonizes history with modernity through its architectural solution. 'Arda Khiva' was built on a 25-hectare area of low-yield, salty land, adjacent to the 150-hectare Govuk Lake. Green areas are being developed around it to make it more attractive for tourists. The President toured the complex and inspected the construction. Exhibitions of handicrafts, applied arts, and local markets were presented. All necessary amenities have been created for tourists: 20 hotels with a total of 1,000 beds reflecting the atmosphere of an ancient city, indoor and outdoor aquaparks and attractions, an amphitheater with 3,000 seats, and a musical fountain. The complex also features 11 craft houses in historical style, an oriental bazaar, the 'Kukhna Urgench' museum, and boat rides along a 2-km canal. It also includes five cinemas and concert halls, numerous restaurants, a jewelry center, shops and stalls, a water motor tourism zone, and a modern parking area. A unified cooling and heating system serves all buildings, and solar panels have been installed for electricity. The complex can accommodate three million visitors per year and will provide employment for over 2,000 people. While Itchan Kala symbolizes history, 'Arda Khiva' will be Khorezm's modern 'calling card'. The President also held a sincere conversation with Khorezm youth. He emphasized that while underground resources may run out one day, the spiritual and architectural heritage left by ancestors continues to serve the people for centuries. We must use this wealth for the benefit of our nation. Much has been done, but many plans still lie ahead. 'I trust you, the youth,' said President Mirziyoyev. 'If you aim high, gain knowledge, and master modern professions, we will surely achieve our great goals.' The discussion also touched on students’ academic success, dreams, and aspirations.
news_description: Kyrgyz guests visited ancient Khiva. President of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev and President of Kyrgyzstan Sadyr Japarov, together with the First Ladies of both countries, visited the Ichan Qala complex and the Nurillaboy Palace complex in the city of Khiva. Khiva was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1990, and its 2500th anniversary was celebrated in 1997. The city was named the Cultural Capital of the Turkic World in 2020 and the Tourism Capital of the Islamic World in 2024. Recognized as an “open-air museum,” Khiva is considered the only city in Central Asia that has preserved its architectural integrity. It is home to over 120 historical monuments. The high-ranking guests began their tour from 'Ota Darvoza', exploring the unique 'Kuhna Ark' complex, Shergazi Khan Madrasah, Juma Mosque, 'Toshhovli' complex, and other landmarks. Traditional Uzbek songs were performed and a theatrical show was presented in honor of the guests. The delegation then visited the Nurillaboy Palace. This palace-park complex was built in the early 20th century. It includes a madrasah, over 100 rooms, and galleries. Alongside Khivan master craftsmen, foreign artists and decorators also took part in designing the palace interiors, blending Eastern style with European modernism. The stories about Khiva’s history, its contributions to science, and the rich culture and art of the land left a deep impression on the Kyrgyz guests.
president_visit_title: Presidents of Uzbekistan and Turkey in Khiva
president_visit_description: President Shavkat Mirziyoyev, along with his wife, arrived in Khorezm on March 30. At the Urgench International Airport, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and his wife were warmly welcomed. National songs and dances were performed. The attendees celebrated the friendship between the Uzbek and Turkish peoples. Today, the two leaders will jointly visit the ancient monuments of Khiva. It is known that the city of Khiva has been declared the cultural capital of the Turkic world.
